topic.title: Installing as non-root, non-sudo
topic.shortdesc: Installation on Mac OS X as non-root, non-sudo user is used only for development purposes.

body.p: If you perform a non-sudo, non-root installation, you can run Couchbase Server and all Couchbase command-line tools.

ol.li: After downloading Couchbase Server, open terminal and go to the Downloads directory:cd ~/Downloads/
Unzip the package containing Couchbase Server: open couchbase-server-enterprise_x86_64_2.1.0.zip
Move Couchbase App to your /Applications folder: mv couchbase-server-enterprise_x86_64_2.1.0/Couchbase/Server.app/Applications/
Start Couchbase Server from the terminal:open /Applications/Couchbase/Server.app This enables you to use Couchbase Server as a non-sudo, non-root user.
To stop the Couchbase Server, click on its icon in the menu bar and select Quit Couchbase Server.
